item.title: Neural architecture search
item.description: tags Search, Neural networks Neural architecture search (NAS) is a method for finding neural networks architectures. It is usually based on three main components: Search space Type of network that can be built. Search strategy The approach for exploring the space. Performance estimation strategy The way the performance of a constructed neural network is evaluated (without actually building it or training/running it). Reinforcement learning-based NAS The original idea was called Neural architecture search and is based on the use of a RNN as a controller and generator of architectures.
